articles.title: J.P. Morgan looks to offer active ETF focused on China
articles.summary: J.P. Morgan is planning to launch an actively managed Exchange Traded Fund (ETF) that will focus its investments on China. This initiative by J.P. Morgan indicates a strategic move to offer investors specialized exposure to the Chinese market through an ETF structure. The announcement was made by Kathie O'Donnell on December 5, 2022.

articles.title: J.P. Morgan and Lincoln Financial Merge Insurance Trust Funds, Joining Forces to Enhance Offerings in the Variable Insurance Trust Space
articles.summary: J.P. Morgan Asset Management and Lincoln Financial Group announced a strengthened partnership to merge four JPMorgan Insurance Trust Portfolios into newly formed series of Lincoln Financial Variable Insurance Products Trust. This initiative aims to enhance Lincoln's variable insurance, retirement, and annuity solutions platform by incorporating J.P. Morgan's investment capabilities. J.P. Morgan will serve as the subadvisor for the acquiring funds, continuing to manage them with their existing portfolio management teams.

articles.title: Mutual Fund to ETF Conversions May Accelerate, CFRA Says
articles.summary: The article discusses the accelerating trend of mutual fund to ETF conversions, with CFRA predicting a "tidal wave" in 2023. It highlights the advantages of ETFs, such as tax efficiency and lower costs, and details the historical growth of ETFs compared to mutual funds. Over $40 billion in mutual funds have already converted, led by firms like JPMorgan and Dimensional, driven by changes like the SEC's 2019 "ETF Rule."

articles.title: NYCB to keep HQ on Long Island, unify brands under Flagstar name after $2.6B merger
articles.summary: New York Community Bancorp (NYCB) will maintain its Hicksville headquarters and rebrand all 10 of its banking labels under the Flagstar name following its $2.6 billion merger with Flagstar Bancorp. This merger creates a financial institution with approximately $90 billion in assets, making it the 24th largest U.S. bank. The unification of brands reverses NYCB's previous strategy of retaining local brands post-acquisition.

articles.title: Akros Technologies, an AI-powered asset management platform, raises funding from Z Holdings
articles.summary: Akros Technologies, an AI-powered asset management platform, has secured $2.3 million from Z Venture Capital, a subsidiary of Z Holdings, bringing its total funding to $6.1 million since 2021. The startup plans to use the funds to scale its AI-driven asset management software and PMaaS product, aiming to onboard over five B2B clients in Q1 2023. Akros's technology reduces fund development costs by over 80% and applies generative AI and GPT-3 NLP to create investment strategies and analyze market data.

articles.title: BlackRock Plans More ETF Fee Cuts as War of Tiny Trims Rolls On
articles.summary: BlackRock Inc., the world's largest ETF issuer, is implementing further fee reductions across eight of its exchange-traded funds amidst the ongoing industry trend of competitive fee cuts. This move impacts several bond and equity ETFs, including the iShares 1-5 Year Investment Grade Corporate Bond ETF, which will see its expense ratio reduced from 0.06% to 0.04%. This strategic decision continues the "war of tiny trims" seen across major financial players like Schwab, Vanguard, and State Street.

articles.title: Delaware District Court: Using Contract Rights to Strategic Advantage Not Grounds for Equitable Subordination in Bankruptcy
articles.summary: The U.S. District Court for the District of Delaware affirmed that using contractual rights to strategic advantage is not grounds for equitable subordination in bankruptcy, a ruling welcomed by lenders. The case, *Tilton v. MBIA Inc. (In re Zohar III, Corp.)*, reinforces that courts require a high bar for misconduct, especially for non-insiders, to justify equitable subordination. This decision provides comfort to lenders looking to enforce their contractual rights without undue exposure to broad lender liability claims.

articles.title: Entergy New Orleans replenishes storm recovery coffers with $209.3 million issuance
articles.summary: Entergy New Orleans (ENO) is issuing approximately $209.3 million in storm recovery bonds to replenish funds depleted by Hurricanes Zeta and Ida. These bonds, secured by storm recovery property, will be repaid through storm recovery charges on ENO's retail electric customers, with the charges adjusted semiannually. Both Moody's and S&P Global Ratings are assigning high ratings to the single tranche issuance, citing ENO's stability and experience as a servicer.

articles.title: Sea Change
articles.summary: The author, with 53 years in investment, identifies three "sea changes" in the investment world: the shift to risk/return thinking in the 70s, the four-decade decline in interest rates starting in the early 80s, and the current reversal of these trends. The memo details how declining rates fueled investment success and how the current environment of higher inflation and interest rates marks a significant departure from the recent past, necessitating new investment strategies.

articles.title: Vietnam's EV maker Vinfast files for U.S. IPO to fuel global expansion
articles.summary: Vietnam's electric-vehicle maker VinFast has filed for an initial public offering (IPO) in the United States to list on the Nasdaq under ticker symbol "VFS", aiming to fund its global expansion including a planned plant in North Carolina. The company will convert to a Singapore public limited company named VinFast Auto Ltd for the IPO, with Citigroup, Morgan Stanley, Credit Suisse, and JP Morgan leading a nine-bank syndicate. This move follows an earlier confidential submission and plans to raise $2 billion with a valuation of around $60 billion, although market conditions have cooled for EV startups.

articles.title: Morgan Stanley Cuts 2% of Global Work Force as Deal-Making Slows (Published 2022)
articles.summary: Morgan Stanley is laying off approximately 2% of its global workforce, impacting around 1,600 employees across all divisions, due to a significant slowdown in deal-making activity. This move comes after the firm had paused layoffs during the pandemic and reflects broader economic jitters and rising interest rates impacting the investment banking sector. Other major banks like Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase have also seen their stock shares decline over the past year.

articles.title: What Will Happen to the Dollar in 2023?
articles.summary: The U.S. dollar, after a strong performance in 2022, is showing signs of weakening as 2023 approaches, which could introduce new inflation risks, particularly through rising commodity prices. This potential decline is influenced by changing Federal Reserve policies, expecting a slower pace of rate hikes, and improving growth expectations outside the U.S., especially in China. A weaker dollar could benefit exporters and international investments but poses challenges for the Fed by potentially reigniting inflation and increasing import costs.

articles.title: First Trust/abrdn Emerging Opportunity Fund Announces Termination and Liquidation
articles.summary: The First Trust/abrdn Emerging Opportunity Fund (NYSE: FEO) completed its termination and liquidation on December 7, 2022, as consistent with its plan announced on September 20, 2022. Shareholders received a liquidating distribution of $9.635572 per common share. Investors are advised to consult a tax advisor regarding the tax implications of this liquidation.

articles.title: DFA Lists 2 New ETFs
articles.summary: DFA has launched two new actively managed exchange-traded funds (ETFs) focused on core equity. The DFA U.S. Core Equity ETF and the DFA World ex-U.S. Core Equity ETF aim to provide broad market exposure with a systematic investment approach. These new offerings expand DFA's suite of active ETF products.

articles.title: Bank of Hope data breach class action settlement
articles.summary: Bank of Hope agreed to a class action settlement to resolve claims that a 2018 data breach exposed Californiansâ€™ sensitive information. The settlement provides reimbursement for out-of-pocket expenses up to $500, two years of free identity-theft protection through Experian, and mandates cybersecurity improvements by Bank of Hope. The deadline for claims and exclusion was February 7, 2023.

articles.title: Wells Fargo Archives
articles.summary: This archive of Finovate articles details Wells Fargo's digital transformation efforts, including the launch of its Vantage digital banking platform for commercial clients and the Flex Loan small dollar financing solution. It also covers Wells Fargo's participation in the Akoya Data Access Network for API-based data aggregation and historical analyses of its website design and mobile banking strategies. The collection highlights the bank's initiatives to enhance customer experience, manage short-term cash needs, and improve digital engagement.
